result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appears via zoom. Victim witness in court.  Includes 22CF367 and 22CF387. 10:30 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Stephanie R Rose who appeared via zoom. V/W present, Victim via zoom. INCLUDES:  22CF367 and 22CF387. Court notes PH's set on both matters. Atty Harrleson notes DE is appearing from Mayo Clinic. Court advises DE or her right to be in person for the PH's. DE waives that right and would like to proceed via zoom. Court calls 22CF387: S/T Deputy Michael Turner, SCSO; direct by Atty Becker. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Atty Becker asks court to take judicial notice of 22CF367 with no objections, court takes judicial notice. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court calls 22CF367 - S/T Officer Andrew Westmoreland, NRPD; direct by Atty Becker. Record reflects identity of DE. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court notes Victim in 22CF387 DE's Aunt L.P. were both present via zoom for todays hearings. Atty Harrelson asks to have victim appear by zoom for ARGN due to treatment, court approves zoom. DE states she will be discharged tomorrow, and going to treatment in Eugene, OR. Court confirms address of DE in Oregon, advises DE that she will receive NOH to that address. Victim / Family are all approved by zoom. Bonds continue in form and amount. Adjourned: 11:04 am.
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

per SJN. hml

Faxed to Dispatch, Quash Sheriff & Jail

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tracy Rose. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
